general_feeling: I was motivated in the beginning but I started getting uncomfortable when I'd use the uban for daily commute or do daily life activities around grocery stores, because people would always stare.
challenges: the glasses would get blurry often and it affected vision. for example I was watching a movie over the weekend, and I had to lift up the glasses for a few seconds to improve clarity of the visuals on screen. also during work, I'd lift them up for a few seconds just to improve focus. And since I don't wear any prescription glasses, to wear something on my eyes for a prolonged period was quite challenging due to lack of adaptation.
act_impact: Commute in the uban. since mostly people are sitting Infront of eachother, they get paranoid about me recording them. so far nobody explicitly called me out, only 2 or 3 people asked out of curiosity, but I realized that people must be thinking that way.
beh_adapt: I tried limiting my daily commute.i for example went to the gym only once last week because I was concerned about people assuming that I'm violating privacy at the gym. or I shifted to working mostly from home. or ask my boyfriend to accompany me for groceries so that I feel comfortable.  Also like I said earlier the glasses would get blurry so I'd lift it often.
social: if I recall correctly, 2-3 people asked me out of curiosity what I was wearing. there first question always was "is this a camera?". they'd sound concerned at first but when I'd tell them it's for light exposure recording, they'd ask more questions out of curiosity and appreciate the effort.
improvements: I think the sensor around neck is feasible design wise.   if you want to resume doing it on eye level, then maybe attach the light logger to a headband with velcro or a cap. this adjustment could atleast remove the discomfort of wearing glasses.
